shortdesc.ph: Sets the EGL context for rendering remote video streams.

Sets the EGL context for rendering remote video streams.

section.p: By setting this method, developers can replace the SDK's default remote EGL context, facilitating unified EGL context management. When the engine is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the EGL context.

By setting this method, developers can replace the SDK's default internal remote EGL context to facilitate unified EGL context management. When the engine is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the EGL context.

By calling this method, developers can replace the SDK's default internal remote EGL context, making it easier to manage a unified EGL context. When the engine is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the EGL context.
section.note: This method is for Android only.
This method is only applicable to Android.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method is applicable in scenarios where remote video rendering is done using video data in Texture format.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
